channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: BriAnna Garza can teach you how to shoot a basketball
item.description: . Kyrie Irving is excellent at his free throws because he’s able to get into a kind of spiritual place. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. What’s the one thing amateur basketball players should work on in the gym to improve their shot? Last year I did a six-month study of watching every single catch-and-shoot in the NBA with 33,000 data points. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. The free throw is so strange because there’s no other shot in basketball like it. How do you coach free throws and how much is mental over technique? So no one shot is going to look exactly the same. If you’re gonna work on one thing, get that down. And there’s a reason Garza thinks deeply about basketball shots—she makes a living from doing it.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Elon Musk unveils ‘master plan’ for Tesla
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. ) of robots Tesla’s been building to do human labor eventually. Musk, who recently reclaimed the title of world’s richest person thanks to a $310 billion surge in Tesla stock, called it his “Master Plan 3” (with a straight face) and tried to sell investors on Tesla’s super-long-term goals.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Eli Lilly finally gives in to insulin price-cut pressure
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeSome diabetic Americans will soon be able to spend less than their monthly internet bill to pick up life-saving medicine. It also said it would cap insulin costs at $35/month when people pay out-of-pocket for the drug. Insulin-makers like Eli Lilly have received growing social and political pressure over the last few years to make insulin more affordable. Drugmaker Eli Lilly said yesterday it would slash the list prices for its two most prescribed insulin products, Humalog and Humulin, by 70%. If you’re feeling a little déjà vu…you’re probably thinking of the viral tweet from November written by Sean Morrow, who paid $8 for a blue checkmark in order to impersonate Eli Lilly and announce that “insulin is free now.” —MM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Lilly is getting ahead of DC dramaThe Inflation Reduction Act included a $35 monthly insulin price cap for seniors on Medicare, and in his State of the Union address last month, President Biden called for expanding that cap to everyone.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: A brief history of EPCOT: Walt Disney's failed city of tomorrow
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Brilliant), Walt Disney conceived of a master-planned city that would exist as one pillar of the Disney World complex in Florida. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. All citizens of the Jetsons-esque city would be working for the Disney company or businesses that worked with Disney. The backstory: Walt Disney was often frustrated with modern city living.

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It's stuck in the mud as Democrats have struggled to round up support for their package that would pour unprecedented sums into health care, education, and climate. This bill also includes billions of dollars for Afghan refugee resettlement and aid for communities hit by recent hurricanes.

item.title: Blue Origin accused of running a sexist ship
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}Subscribe21 current and former employees of Jeff Bezos’s space company, Blue Origin, published an open letter on Thursday describing it as a “toxic” workplace “rife with sexism.” Spearheaded by Blue Origin’s former head of employee communications, Alexandra Abrams, the letter alleges that the company is dismissive of safety concerns, creates a sexist environment for female employees, and stifles professional dissent. —MK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! The behavior was so well known, the letter claims, that some women at the company would warn new female hires to stay away from the executive (who, according to the letter, had a close personal relationship with Jeff Bezos). They also wrote that another former male executive would inquire about female employees’ dating lives, referring to them as “baby doll” or “baby girl.”
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: What’s once a month and too damn high?
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Pour one out for renters in... The median national rent for a one-bedroom apartment is up 10.7% from March 2020, while two-bedrooms are up 13%, according to the Zumper National Rent Report. —MK Why the surge?
item.author: Max Knoblauch

The new regulations amount to one of China’s most dramatic attempts to reset the relationship between business and culture in recent memory.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Report reveals Ozy Media tried to trick Goldman Sachs
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. What that report revealed: On a phone call in February between executives at Ozy and Goldman Sachs—which was at the time considering a $40 million investment into the company—Ozy cofounder and COO Samir Rao impersonated a YouTube exec in order to tout Ozy’s success on the platform. the story of Ozy Media sounds like it’s straight out of daytime TV. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Dollar Tree says it will add more items that cost over $1

item.title: Macy’s sues over potential Amazon billboard
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Macy’s said an ad from a company like Amazon would damage the “customer goodwill, image, reputation, and brand,” according to the filing. The chain crushed Q2 earnings and reported that digital customers accounted for 41% of its 5 million new shoppers last quarter. And like anyone with property that close to a Shake Shack, the department store chain is holding onto it for dear life, even suing the ad agency that owns the billboard. Neither Amazon nor Kaufman have responded to the lawsuit or the claims. —MM css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIt appears that Amazon is after another piece of Macy’s business: its iconic NYC billboard.

item.title: Vaccine Mandates Are Highly Effective at Getting Hesitant Workers to Vax Up, Early Data Shows
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Another closely watched mandate was implemented by New York’s health system, which required all workers to have at least one vaccine dose by Monday. Around 90% of NBA players are vaccinated, much higher than the US’ overall vaccination rate, but the league is likely frustrated that one of its most influential stars is, at least for now, bucking the trend.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: . Users will be able to set boundary limits on which rooms Astro can enter, and even make it beatbox. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Astro is $999 for Day One purchasers, and will cost $1,499 once widely released.

item.title: Chinese Factories Go Offline as Power Crunch Bites
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. As the UK confronts its own gas shortages, a widespread energy crunch in China has led to power cuts and forced a chunk of its muscular manufacturing sector offline. Beijing has instituted tougher emissions standards to curb the country’s coal use, which accounts for more than 70% of China’s electricity generation. —SQ What’s going on? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Why it matters: Add China’s electricity shortage to the laundry list of problems crimping the global supply chain, which is about to come under even more pressure ahead of the holiday shopping season. Goldman Sachs became the latest bank to cut China’s GDP forecast on account of the energy shortages.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: MacArthur Fellow Joshua Miele Creates Technology for the Blind
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In a nutshell, Miele creates accessible technology for blind people like himself. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Here are some of the amazing projects Miele has led:Fire tablets that are Braille-compatible, and a “Show and Tell” feature on Echo devices that can identify different foods and pantry items“Tactile maps” for the Bay Area’s BART train—known for ferrying tech workers to and from San Francisco and the suburbs—that users can explore with their fingers and an audio smart pen“YouDescribe,” a platform that crowdsources audio descriptions for popular videos+ Read Miele’s backstory here, and learn more about the 24 other 2021 MacArthur fellows here.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Investing Is So Easy a Hamster Can Do It
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. could select a portfolio that would do just as well as one carefully selected by experts.” —MK
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Head of Instagram hits pause on 'Instagram Kids' after...a lot of pushback
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeFacebook, like so many of us after one bad summer camp gig, has pumped the brakes on its plans to work with kids. The head of FB-owned Instagram, Adam Mosseri, announced yesterday that the company would be pausing development for “Instagram Kids,” a version of its platform for users under 13. The most relevant insight: Facebook’s internal research showed that Instagram made body image issues worse for one in three teen girls, and called Instagram “toxic.” In a blog post rebutting the investigation, Facebook’s Head of Research Pratiti Raychoudhury pushed back on the WSJ’s accusations, saying that its platforms were not toxic. If you think babies who can use iPhones are scary, just wait until you hear about how terrified people are of tweens navigating social media. —MM + While we’re here: If Instagram for kids doesn’t work out, Facebook still has the metaverse.
item.author: Matty Merritt

Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Kelly’s music from their platforms? (New York Times) The big question facing the industry now is, will streamers like Spotify and Apple Music remove R. Quote: “This is by far the highest-profile, post-Me Too conviction involving sexual abuse that we’ve seen in the music industry.” Kelly’s conviction yesterday into perspective.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Two Fed Leaders Announce Retirement on the Same Day
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. “I think no one is happy,” he said. Kaplan directly linked the trading controversy to his retirement: “Unfortunately, the recent focus on my financial disclosure risks becoming a distraction” to the Fed’s work. —NF Good deal on a Winnebago? Zoom out: At a press conference last week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell made clear he was not pleased about the stock trading controversy, and pledged to look into the Fed’s ethics guidelines. Earlier this month, both Kaplan and Rosengren said they would sell their stocks to avoid any conflicts of interest. Rosengren didn’t mention his stock trading. Kaplan especially was #buyingthedip—he executed big trades in stocks such as Amazon, Apple, and Delta last year as the Fed flooded the market with liquidity. Both Kaplan and Rosengren have come under fire after new disclosures showed they were active traders while determining the country’s monetary policy. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeNot one, but two Federal Reserve leaders—Dallas Fed President Robert Kaplan and Boston Fed President Eric Rosengren—announced their retirement yesterday.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: South Korea's 'Squid Game' Surges to No. 1 Spot on Netflix Leaderboard
item.description: . css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe No. 1 show on Netflix right now isn’t Cocomelon or Sex Education, but instead a South Korean thriller called Squid Game. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One analyst told Bloomberg that Korean companies could pose a “serious competitive threat” to Hollywood powerhouse studios.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Congress Faces Three Big Deadlines This Week as Biden Agenda Hangs in Balance
item.description: . As they eye the midterm elections coming up next year, Democrats want to be able to show voters they can get things done and make a positive difference in Americans’ lives. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. On top of all that, Congress will need to fund the federal government past Thursday at midnight in order to avoid a partial government shutdown. It’s already passed the Senate with support from Republicans, but more progressive Democrats want to prioritize the social spending bill. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi wants Democrats to pass two huge packages: 1) the roughly $1 trillion bipartisan infrastructure bill and 2) the $3.5 trillion spending bill that would inject an unprecedented amount of federal dollars into the social safety net, climate change mitigation, and education. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Neal Freyman

Protestors rallied in Germany ahead of the vote to pressure the government to do more to limit emissions. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeAngela Merkel not leading Germany is like someone other than Mike Krzyzewski coaching Duke basketball, but that’s what’s going to happen after Germans voted in federal elections yesterday.

I like to think I’m Philadelphia’s version of Mowgli from Jungle Book. But I know for a fact he could never beat me at disc golf. If Gritty went public as a company, what would your trading ticker be? I don’t give plugs to bad twitter accounts. Sometimes they seem like an inch wide and other times they look more like hairs. Where did gritty come from? How they ever found a chimpanzee that was good at hockey, skateboarding, and snowboarding is beyond me. Would you ever go solo? Sometimes I just kick my feet up at lunch and throw it in my Blu-ray player. Morning Brew caught up with Gritty to discuss the big three: social media, sports, and Philly cheesesteaks.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Expanded Booster Shot Eligibility at Odds With CDC Advisors
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. What happened: After outside advisors to the CDC recommended that older Americans and those with underlying health conditions be eligible for boosters, Walensky made a rare “my house, my rules” move and included frontline health care workers, teachers, and others who face higher risk of infection because of their jobs or living conditions. And if you are 18–49 with health risks or 18–64 with a risky job/living situation, you can get a booster if you want.

item.title: China Outlaws All Crypto Transactions
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The order reiterated a pre-existing ban on overseas exchanges conducting transactions within China. But China’s crypto crackdown had several, well, cracks that yesterday’s statement sealed up:Chinese residents can no longer trade crypto on peer-to-peer platforms like WeChat Pay and AliPay (the Venmo and Zelle of China). Mining cryptocurrency is now completely illegal. Having an official digital currency will allow China to better monitor citizens’ economic activity, and enforce rules accordingly. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Jamie Wilde

Related: Why three CBD marketers pivoted to pot. 321,000 Americans now work in the industry, a 32% bump from last year, a new report estimates. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeStat: Turns out your college roommate was onto something—the US now has more legal cannabis workers than dentists, paramedics, or electrical engineers, according to the Washington Post.

item.title: Costco and Nike Air Their Supply Chain Dirty Laundry
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Some of the headwinds Costco faces include “port delays, container shortages, Covid disruptions, shortages of various components, raw materials and ingredients, labor cost pressures, and truck and driver shortages,” the company’s CFO Richard Galanti said, likely not in one breath. —NF
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Legend of the $1 Trillion Platinum Coin
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. As Bloomberg’s Joe Weisenthal explains, none of this would lead to inflation because it’s merely an “accounting trick”—not an influx of money into the economy. The $1 trillion platinum coin idea seems to pop up every time the US faces a debt ceiling crunch. But each time the $1 trillion coin is mentioned as a way of resolving debt ceiling problems, the people in charge dismiss it as a distraction from Congress doing its job. The solution: Yellen could have the Treasury mint a $1 trillion platinum coin, deposit it at the Fed to “retire” loads of US federal debt, and then enable the government to carry on with business as usual without having to worry about defaulting on its existing debt. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeYou may have heard that a deadline to suspend the debt ceiling is rapidly approaching, and if lawmakers don’t do anything it could lead to “economic catastrophe,” in the words of Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen. “If we have a crisis over the debt ceiling, it will be only because the Treasury Department would rather see economic devastation than look silly for a couple of minutes,” he wrote.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Make It Work: Is My Boss Clueless or Just a Jerk?
item.description: . My boss never inquired ahead of time nor said anything afterward about my not being able to attend.
